etymons.meaning: to make perfect, just; Не согласен с арамейской этимологией < Arab. tmm cf. Wehr 144: zu Ende kommen, beendet sein od. werden; yet cf. tmm G in JBA ‘cease’ + md ‘sein, werden, bleiben’

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: i=ḥəkkay-ayḏi-stehawxatayimo 512; 7/17; prs 17/35; 79/24; 80/23; tayimo i=masale 512; 76/142; tayimo i=marʕ-aṯṯe 512; 53/56; tayimiaʕ=ʕeze 512; prs 207/3; tayəm u=ʕaza d-u=babo

Infectum.turoyo: ko-taymohawxa b-u=šəkl-ano i=laystke d-i=ʕisaqṯo 519; 94/474; lo=k-taymiak=kallat 520; prs 98/2;

Infectum-wa.turoyo: əzze-wo i=naqqa d-tam-wo aʕ=ʕezeaʕle, šŭqal-wo b-u=zōr; b-u=sayf-ayḏe 524; 29/284;

Preterit.turoyo: matəmle u=mukl-awo 538; 73/341; kamili a=tloṯo=yawmayḏe, lə=matəmle i=ʕaskarayḏe 538; 65/498; bəṯṯər me d-matəmle u=šuġl-ayḏe u=malko k-oṯe ko-yotaw-le saʕayeʕam a=bnoṯ-ayḏe
translations: ‘After he finished his work, the king used to come and sit with his daughters for a long time’ 77/21;
‘He began to build (…), and it (bath-house, m.) was finished in less than

Infectum.turoyo: gəm-matəm u=ḥayatdiḏe 545; 30/118; bəṯṯər me-d-matəm, ṭr-oṯe 545; 75/46; g-matimono u=layšayḏimašiġonoiḏi 548; 78/189;
